title.rendered: Mumbai vs Gujarat, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Mumbai: Yastika Bhatia (wk), Hayley Matthews, Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Dhara Gujjar, Amelia Kerr, Issy Wong, Amanjot Kaur, Humaira Kazi, Jintimani Kalita, Saika Ishaque

Gujarat: Sabbhineni Meghana, Laura Wolvaardt/Sophia Dunkley, Harleen Deol, Ashleigh Gardner, Dayalan Hemalatha, Georgia Wareham, Sushma Verma (wk), Kim Garth, Tanuja Kanwar, Sneh Rana (c), Mansi Joshi

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 166

2nd innings average score: 197

Wickets per innings: 5

Type: Good batting wicket

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Saika Ishaque’s variation in pace and accuracy have been the talk of the tournament. She is the leading wicket-taker (12), including consecutive three-fors.

Besides picking three wickets, Nat Sciver-Brunt has been dismissed only once in this competition. Thanks to her dual skills, she has featured in the Best11 for the last five games.

Aside from inflicting five dismissals, Yastika Bhatia has added scores of 42 and 23 at the Brabourne Stadium in her last two outings.

Sophia Dunkley (65 off 28) and Harleen Deol (67 off 45) were the power players for Gujarat when they last played at the Brabourne Stadium.

In addition to picking 14 wickets, including the best figures of three for 31 at the Brabourne stadium, Ashleigh Gardner has collected 154 runs at 22 in her last 10 competitive T20s.

Harmanpreet Kaur has three fifties and a score of 11* in the last four outings – of which one fifty came at the venue.

When these teams locked horns earlier in the league, Amelia Kerr (45 runs and two wickets) and Saika  (3.1-1-12-4) were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 Team respectively.

After four games into the tournament, Tanuja Kanwar has only a wicket to show for her efforts.
